page.title: 11ST CHADS CHURCH SUTTON C'FLD
page.content: One local parish church is that of St.Chadwick or{St.Chad's.}Inside the layout is of cruciform shape. The outside also looks traditional being of rough cut Cotswold{stone.}But a twentieth century{steel}frame provides structural strength! A side chapel was added in 1977 to commemorate the{Golden Jubilee. } Carved{wood}is a major feature of internal decoration.A guilded reredos rises on the east wall above the altar.A triptych adorns this focal point.The central panel colourfully depicts the life of{Jesus.}This is flanked by two other Biblical scenes. {Music}is provided by an organ. The Church serves a wider community as well as the membership.For example every Christmas{John Willmott School } pupils walk to the Church for the annual{Carol Service.}
